item.title: Asian Equities to Rise as US Jobs Buoy Sentiment: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian equities were set to climb Friday following fresh highs for US stocks as strong jobs data eased concerns the economy slowing down.
item.dc:creator: Richard Henderson

item.title: Peru Copper Snags Highlight Rising Clout of Informal Miners
item.description: Copper transport disruptions this week in Peru underscore the growing impact of informal mining on global mining corporations that operate in the Andean nation.
item.dc:creator: James Attwood

media:content.media:description: A mining truck travels near the MMG Ltd. Las Bambas copper mine in Apurimac, Peru, on Thursday, Sept. 5, 2024. Peru's massive copper deposits are key to meeting growing global demand but a battle has emerged over who gets to mine and sell them.

item.title: Hong Kong Intervenes to Defend FX Peg for Third Time in a Week
item.description: Hong Kong’s de-facto central bank bought the city’s dollar again to defend its foreign-exchange peg, as two previous rounds of intervention failed to send funding costs high enough to dampen bearish currency bets.
item.dc:creator: Julia Zhong

media:content.media:description: Hong Kong five-hundred and one-hundred dollar banknotes are arranged for a photograph in Hong Kong, China, on Thursday, April 23, 2020. Hong Kong's defense of its currency peg to the greenback will likely boost the interbank liquidity pool to a level unseen in two years, lowering local borrowing costs and weakening its dollars.

item.title: Supreme Court Clears Trump to Send Migrants to South Sudan
item.description: A divided US Supreme Court said the Trump administration is free to send eight migrants to South Sudan, rejecting a judge’s interpretation of a recent high court decision.
item.dc:creator: Greg Stohr

media:content.media:description: The US Supreme Court in Washington, DC. Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg

item.title: Activist Investor Starboard Builds 9% Stake in Tripadvisor
item.description: Starboard Value LP has built a 9% stake in Tripadvisor Inc. and intends to engage with the travel booking and review site on how to unlock value.
item.dc:creator: Crystal Tse

item.title: Alberta Oil Production Falls to Lowest in Two Years
item.description: Alberta’s oil production fell to the lowest in two years in May as wildfires and maintenance work crimped oil sands output.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

item.title: Gold Drops After Strong Jobs Number Makes Early Fed Cut Unlikely
item.description: Gold dropped after strong US jobs data took the pressure off the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates at the end of this month.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan

item.title: US House Passage of Tax Bill | The Close 7/3/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Claudia Sahm New Century Advisors, Kevin Gordon Charles Schwab, Patrick De Haan Gasbuddy, Kathy Entwistle Morgan Stanley, Liz Ann Sonders, Charles Schwab, Debbie Dyson Oneten, Michael Balboni NY Former Director of Homeland Security, Brian Kelly The Points Guy, and Scott Bessent US Treasury Secretary. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Refiners Rely on Shale More Than Ever as Heavy Oil Supplies Dwindle
item.description: American refiners are relying on oil supplies from the country’s biggest shale basins more than ever as flows of denser varieties from places like Mexico and Canada ebb.
item.dc:creator: Lucia Kassai

media:content.media:description: An oil drilling rig on the Permian Basin near Stanton, Texas.

item.title: Treasuries Get Hit as Stocks Jump on Jobs Surprise: Markets Wrap
item.description: Bonds fell and the dollar rose as stronger-than-forecast employment growth soothed concern the US economy is poised to slow, stanching speculation the Federal Reserve will need to cut interest rates any time soon. Stocks hit fresh all-time highs.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: “This is one of the best tactical investment environments,” according to Wei Li, global chief investment strategist at BlackRock, who says her firm still likes US equities.

item.title: New Jersey Shore School’s Bankruptcy Threat Triggers Bond Rout
item.description: A New Jersey school district is threatening to file bankruptcy after years of state funding cuts, escalating a showdown with Governor Phil Murphy’s administration and causing outstanding debt to sell off.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Albright, Sri Taylor

item.title: Husband-and-Wife Team’s Bold Foray Into Oil Refining Ends Badly
item.description: When the French oil major TotalEnergies SE was struggling to find a buyer for the Lindsey oil refinery in England back in 2020, an unlikely bidder rode to the rescue: a husband-and-wife team with no track record in refining. Their foray into the industry ended in catastrophic failure this week.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Nimmo, Archie Hunter, Rachel Graham

media:content.media:description: The Prax Lindsey oil refinery in North Killingholme, England, on Oct. 4, 2021.

item.title: Bessent on Tax Bill, Treasury Financing and US Dollar
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent discusses the possible economic impact of President Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill," the Treasury's financing needs and the recent decline in the US dollar on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CIBC Urges Firms to ‘Be Bold’ in M&A-Focused Stock Deals
item.description: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce says investors this year have rewarded Canadian companies that have sold shares to fund acquisitions, and it’s urging firms to take more risks and pursue deals.
item.dc:creator: Geoffrey Morgan

item.title: Jobs Numbers Giving Some Breathing Room: Sahm
item.description: New Century Advisors Chief Economist Claudia Sahm discusses the jobs numbers, growth and inflation. She speaks with Matt Miller and Romaine Bostick on Bloomberg TV. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US House Passes Tax Bill, Sending It to Trump
item.description: The US House of Representatives passed a $3.4 trillion fiscal package that cuts taxes, curtails spending on safety-net programs, and reverses much of Joe Biden’s efforts to move the country toward a clean-energy economy. Mike Dorning reports.

item.title: Oil Falls in Choppy Trading on Report US to Restart Iran Talks
item.description: Oil declined after Axios reported the US plans to restart nuclear talks with Iran, reducing the risk of another flare-up in the Middle East conflict.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Catherine Cartier

media:content.media:description: A refinery in Houston, Texas. Photographer: Mark Felix/Bloomberg

item.title: Bessent Dismisses Concerns Over US Dollar’s Recent Drop
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent rejects the idea that the dollar’s recent declines raise concerns about its status as the world’s key currency during an interview on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Colombia Eyes ‘Unprecedented’ Franc Loans to Ease Debt Costs
item.description: Colombia is seeking to borrow as much as $10 billion in Swiss francs to fund the repurchase of more expensive liabilities in a bid to rein in the nation’s burgeoning debt service costs.
item.dc:creator: Oscar Medina

item.title: Ghana’s Domestic Bond Yields Fall as Inflation Data Spurs Demand
item.description: Ghana’s domestic bond yields extended declines on Thursday after the West African nation reported inflation dropped to the lowest in more than three years.
item.dc:creator: Moses Mozart Dzawu

item.title: Elliott-Backed Cubic Revamps Debt in Deal That Adds Fresh Equity
item.description: Elliott Investment Management and Veritas Capital Fund Management-backed Cubic Corp. has reached an agreement with creditors to cut its debt load and extend maturities in a deal that will also see the private equity sponsors inject fresh equity into the struggling company.
item.dc:creator: Georgia Hall, Reshmi Basu

media:content.media:description: Commuters during the morning rush hour at the Fulton Center subway station in New York, US, on Tuesday, July 30, 2024. New York City’s aging transit system needs 2,000 new subway and commuter rail cars, 60 miles of new subway tracks and upgraded power stations, according to the MTA’s five-year capital plan.

item.title: Copper Slides Below $10,000 Amid Concerns of Easing Demand
item.description: Copper slipped below $10,000 a ton in London amid concerns of cooling demand after prices rallied to a three-month high earlier in the week.
item.dc:creator: Elise Harris

item.title: Bessent Sees US Banks Taking Up More Debt Due to SLR Relief
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says inflation seems to be under control and expects US banks to take up more debt due to supplementary leverage ratio (SLR) relief during an interview on "Bloomberg Television." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: GasBuddy's Haan on Gas Prices Falling Ahead of July 4
item.description: Patrick De Haan, Head of Petroleum Analysis at GasBuddy, discusses gasoline prices falling ahead of the July 4th holiday to its lowest levels since 2021. Patrick speaks with Matt Miller and Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg's The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Glencore Has Share Pledges as Security for Prax Debt
item.description: Commodity trading giant Glencore Plc has security mechanisms as part of its agreement with the owners of the Lindsey oil refinery in northern England that give it a claim on parts of the company if the debt it’s owed isn’t repaid.
item.dc:creator: Archie Hunter

media:content.media:description: The Prax Lindsey Oil Refinery is pictured in North Killingholme, north east England on October 4, 2021. - The British military started delivering fuel to petrol stations on Monday, after a tanker driver shortage sparked two weeks of panic-buying by motorists and emptied pumps. (Photo by Lindsey Parnaby / AFP) (Photo by LINDSEY PARNABY/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: The Future For Meta's Threads
item.description: Two years after its debut, Meta's social media platform Threads is still in search of being relevant among its peers. Bloomberg's Kurt Wagner joins Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Influencers Tread Carefully Over Political Posts
item.description: Lawyers are warning content creators to avoid politics as the US immigration crackdown spreads. Bloomberg’s Cecilia D'Anastasio joins Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Quant Hedge Funds Ride Whiplash Markets to First-Half Riches
item.description: From Treasury market reversals to trade threats, the first half of 2025 was dominated by policy upheaval and Wall Street angst. The dollar famously fell, while commodities and risky assets were whipsawed. But inside the markets where the world’s biggest quants operate, a funny thing happened: Time-honored trading patterns prevailed.
item.dc:creator: Justina Lee, Nishant Kumar

item.title: Dr. Phil’s Media Firm Fired Most Employees, Ended Production When It Filed Bankruptcy
item.description: Merit Street Media, the television startup founded by celebrity psychologist Phil McGraw, laid off all but six of its employees the day it filed bankruptcy, saying it can’t make any new content after being forced out of business by its broadcasting partner.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church

item.title: Bond Traders Scrap Bets on July Rate Cut After Strong Jobs Data
item.description: Treasuries tumbled after a stronger-than-expected jobs report for June prompted traders to exit bets on an interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie, Michael Mackenzie

media:content.media:description: A worker operates a forklift at a fulfillment center in Elizabeth, New Jersey.
